metainfo: THis form is for health history
preamble: Respected Sir, I the undersigned, having an interest in learning Fitness Sciences at the K11 School of Fitness Sciences; enquired at the School and as is the due process of admission in K11; an appointment was fixed with a K11 Course Counsellor, who provided me with all the information about the courses, examinations to be passed that are mandatory for certification, scope in the fitness industry, job roles in the fitness industry, income potential, placement assistance provided by the School post successful certification. After giving due consideration to all the information provided, I have decided to join for the below mentioned Course at the K11 School of Fitness Sciences. I hereby, AFFIRM, that the K11 Counsellor has made me fully aware of the points mentioned below in the counselling session held

sections.sectionName: I hereby, AFFIRM, that the K11 Counsellor has made me fully aware of the points mentioned below in the counselling session held

fields.label: Fees paid by the student are purely for the knowledge dispensed through the courses and in no way are to be considered as payment for an assured certification.
The outcome of the examinations, whether CLEARED or NOT CLEARED and the marks earned are at the sole discretion of the Assessor, based on the student’s performance on the day of the examinations.
The examination Department does not comprise the teaching faculty at K11. This is done in the interest of fair and bias-free examinations.
Upon NOT CLEARING the examinations, a student is provided with a reattempt at no cost. All subsequent attempts from the third attempt onward are charged at a nominal Examination fee.

Students who do not CLEAR the examinations will be granted permission to re-attend the classroom sessions, upon receiving a request application on support@keleven.com or through the Student Support section on www.keleven.com.

There are 3 Unit Tests conducted at certain intervals during classroom-based Theory sessions. The Unit Tests are conducted by the Teaching Faculty simply to facilitate an understanding of the comprehension and feedback. They have no bearing on the final examination outcome.
K11 has a strict NO REFUND POLICY, and a student not clearing the examinations in NO way makes K11 liable for a refund.

Upon successfully clearing the examinations; K11 cannot in any way guarantee jobs in the fitness industry. The outcome of the interview with the industry is purely based on the decision of the organisation that you seek employment in.

K11 is the largest human resource provider to the Indian Fitness Industry and thus promises its students excellent Placement Assistance. Placement Assistance entails: 
 - Providing opportunities for interviews in the best commercial gyms in the country that seek K11 Certified fitness professionals. 
 - Guiding how to give an effective interview that increases the chances of getting selected. 
 - Providing students with guidance on how to present professionally formatted resumes. 
 - Arranging by appointment, interviews in commercial gyms that are professional in their commitments with regards to timely and fair salaries, commissions; and those that have a very good income potential ensured by clientele with a high purchasing power. 
 All these efforts made by K11 for the students who pass the examinations and get certified increases the potential for employability but in no way can or should be misconstrued as a Job Guarantee

If during the tenure of the course I find myself unfit to perform the Practical Module and/or Practical examinations of Exercise Execution due to a medical condition: acute or chronic, then I must submit a letter from my doctor/physician stating the medical condition in detail. 
 A letter or note from my doctor(s) / physician(s), stating that I am unfit for the practical module and/or examinations, will be given due credit to avoid an exercise assigned in the practical examinations of Exercise Execution OR in postponing the dates of Practical examinations of Exercise Execution. I also understand that the outcome of Examinations in such a case will be as NOT CLEARED status and will have to be done in the subsequent attempt for successful certification.
I also understand that the subsequent examination attempt will be scheduled only after my doctor/physician provides me with a medical clearance certificate (Fit for Practicals Examinations).

fields.title: Note: The K11 Diploma in Personal Training (DPT) Certification Course is recognized for professional registration by the Register for Exercise Professionals, India Foundation (REPS India) under the category of Personal Trainer.
fields.label: This registration makes a professional internationally portable for employment as a Personal Trainer to the 6 member nations of the International Confederation of Registers for Exercise Professionals (ICREPs) viz. the United Arab Emirates (UAE), Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, Ireland, and Poland. The first year membership fee to REPS India is included in the K11 DPT Certification Course fees which provides professional registration to the student of DPT. This privilege is made available to the student only after s/he successfully clears all applicable examination.

sections.sectionName: I hereby, AFFIRM, that the K11 Counsellor has made me fully aware of the points mentioned below in the counselling session held

fields.title: DECLARATION : I the undersigned
fields.label: Having an interest in learning Fitness Sciences at the K11 School of Fitness Sciences; enquired at the school and as is the due process of admission in K11; an appointment was fixed with a K11 Course Counsellor, who provided me with all the information about the courses, examinations to be passed that are mandatory for certification, scope in the fitness industry, job roles in the fitness industry, income potential, placement assistance provided by the School post successful certification.
Student is required to pay an initial amount as a down-payment to confirm his/ her seat for the course they plan to enroll for. Student can also choose to pay the entire course fee.
Admission to the course and associated privileges are valid only for the specific course, and for the duration of the course.

All declarations made in the student admission form for admission are accepted in good faith. Any false declarations about the information provided or failure to produce documentary evidence of the information provided may render a student liable to expulsion from the course in which he/ she has sought admission. A student will NOT be entitled to ANY REFUND.
If the student admission form is signed on behalf of the student by his/ her parent/ sponsor/ guardian/ representative, all terms and conditions still apply.
Course fees are inclusive of Theory and Practical (if applicable) study, two attempts at the examinations and all certification as mentioned in the course details above.
CPR & AED fees (wherever applicable) are to be paid directly to the Institute representative at the time of the lecture
ALL PAYMENTS must be made at the Registration Desk.

Students who avail of the finance facility MUST complete all formalities like payment of down payment, submission of all relevant documents and Post-Dated Cheques (wherever applicable) before the day of batch start.

In the event of a payment made by the Cheque being dishonoured, a student will be required to pay the dishonoured amount and the Cheque bounce charges in Cash/ Credit or Debit Card/ Demand-Draft/ Pay-Order/ NEFT/ RTGS/ Payment Wallet immediately. A student who fails to make this payment will be restricted by the Management from attending the course until the balance amount is cleared.

For students who avail of the finance facility and have completed the course successfully before all the EMIs are paid off, the student will only be handed over the certificate(s) upon full payment of fees (through foreclosure or completion of EMIs).
A student may choose to foreclose the entire balance of the EMI amount by applying for the same with the relevant NBFC.

In case a student pays the course fees and doesn't attend or finish the course curriculum for any reason, the course fees that he/ she has paid would be frozen only for 1 year from the date of payment. Even if there is a revision in course fees for that course within one year, the student will still get to appear for all relevant examinations as per the applicable examination rules without paying any difference. Post the one year, the student will have to pay the difference in course fees (if any) to be eligible for applicable examinations.
The course(s) offered are “as is”. The student assumes the responsibility for the admission to the course and NO REFUND will be issued under any circumstances

Student(s) would be required to appear for the applicable examination(s) on completion of the course curriculum. The examination(s) must be completed only in the order mentioned below: 
 a) DIPLOMA IN PERSONAL TRAINING(DPT) Certification Course: In the order of Theory, Practical Viva– Exercise Execution, Practical Viva– Training Programme Delivery, and NSQF Level 4. 
 b) HUMAN PERFORMANCE NUTRITION(HPN) Certification Course: In the order of Theory and Practical 
 c) PERSONAL TRAINING for SPECIAL POPULATIONS(PT - SP) Certification Course: Theory exam 
 d) Certified Master Trainer(MT): Practical and Viva

Student will be allotted dates to appear for his/ her examination(s). In case a student is not able to appear for the examination(s) on the allotted date, then he/ she is required to send an examination date change request to the K11 Student Support cell on  support@keleven.com, a minimum of 2 days before the given examination date. In case the student is absent to take the examination(s) on the given date(s) without prior intimation, then he/ she will be marked as 'Absent’ and the examination attempt will be counted

A student during the course tenure will have to appear for Unit Tests & submit assignments (wherever applicable) for the course that they have joined. Attendance for the Unit Tests & submission of assignments is compulsory for the students. A student will NOT be allowed to appear for the final examination(s) if they have not appeared for any of the Unit Tests and/ or have not completed the assignments submission for the respective course(s) where it is applicable

In case a student wishes to appear for Unit Tests in any other batch apart from the batch for which he/ she has joined, a request for the same needs to be sent to the K11 Student Support cell on support@keleven.com
Students are required to maintain a minimum of 90% attendance to be eligible for examination(s).

A student will have 2 examination attempts each for Theory, Practical & Viva (wherever applicable) and Practical & Viva 2 (wherever applicable) included in the course fee. A student who does not clear OR does not appear without prior intimation for the first scheduled exam(s), would then be allowed to take the second attempt without any cost

If in the second attempt, the student has still not cleared the examination(s) or any part of it, then all subsequent attempts after the second attempt would be charged a nominal examination fee of INR 560/- per examination section, per attempt. This allows the student to appear for only those parts of the examination that he/ she has not cleared

If a student of the Diploma in Personal Training Certification Course, does not clear or does not appear (without prior intimation) for the NSQF Level 4 (Fitness Trainer) examination by SPEFL-SC in the first attempt, the second attempt will be paid. The applicable fee at the time of the NSQF Level 4 (Fitness Trainer)examination will have to be borne by the student from the second attempt onward

A student would be made to take all Theory examination(s) (MCQs) electronically. The student has the option to take the exam from the school or remotely. Student(s) who opt to take the Theory exam remotely, can do so from their mobile handset device. In both cases, the examination will be conducted using the K11 Examination App. In case of Practical and Viva examination(s), all observations and submissions will be recorded by the assessor electronically via tablet PCs

Any student who believes that a piece of work submitted for examination in the form of Theory, Practical and/ or Viva has been assessed unfairly, inconsistently or is not per the training curriculum, can appeal to the school by visiting www.keleven.com and filling up the form under the Support Section
Practical attendance card (wherever applicable) is mandatory to be presented during examination(s).

In case a student does not appear or does not clear the examination(s), the course fees which the student has paid would be frozen only for 1 year from the date of the last lecture. Even if there is a revision in course fees for that course within one year, the student will still get to appear for all relevant examination(s) as per the applicable examination rules without paying any difference. Post the one year, the student will have to pay the difference in course fees (if any) to be eligible for applicable examination(s).
The examination structure and the evaluation system are at the sole discretion of the management and are subject to change without prior notice.

Passing Criteria:
 To earn the course certification, a student must meet the passing criteria that is set by the school for the course that they have enrolled in. The passing criteria for the respective courses are mentioned below for reference: 
 - To earn the DPT Certification, a student must score a minimum of 70% in Theory, and 60% in Practical & Viva - Exercise Execution (with 60% scored in each movement/exercise in both Practical & Viva). A student must have also completed the submission of assignments of training program delivery as part of Practical & Viva - Training Program Delivery exams 
- To earn the PT-SP Certification, a student must score a minimum of 70% in the Theory  exams 
 - To earn the HNP Certification, a student must score a minimum of 70% each in Theory and Diet Planning which is part of the practical exams 
 - To earn the Master Trainer Certification, a student must score a minimum of 60% each in Practical and Viva (with 60% scored in each movement/exercise in both Practical & Viva)
A student who scores an aggregate of 85% or above in his/her exams in the FIRST ATTEMPT will be deemed to have scored a DISTINCTION
The name on the certificate issued to a student will be as mentioned on the Government ID proof submitted at the time of admission

Valid CPR & AED certificates from a Government Recognized body is compulsory while collecting the Diploma in Personal Training (DPT), Personal Training for Special Populations (PT-SP) and the Master Trainer Certification. Additionally, for the Master Trainer course, a student must also be an active member of the Register for Exercise Professionals, India (REPS India)

All applicable certificate(s) will be couriered to the student(s) address within 40 days from their last examination date. The certification will be issued ONLY after the student has cleared all applicable examination(s) that pertain to the course

In case of a certificate being lost/ stolen/ damaged, a student can apply for a duplicate certificate. The student would be required to send an email application to support@keleven.com stating the reason along with a Photo ID Proof. A duplicate certificate would be issued to student ONLY if s/he holds a VALID certificate at the time of making a request

The validity period of certification for the following courses is 24 months from the date of certification: 
   - HUMAN PERFORMANCE NUTRITION  (HPN)  Certification Course 
   - PERSONAL TRAINING for SPECIAL POPULATIONS (PT-SP)  Certification Course 
   - K11 Master Trainer (MT)

Re-Validation:
 Students of the HUMAN PERFORMANCE NUTRITION  (HPN)  Certification Course and the PERSONAL TRAINING for SPECIAL POPULATIONS (PT-SP)  Certification Course, can re-validate their certification by clearing the relevant examination(s) of that course 
 a) A student who chooses to re-validate their certification within the certificate validity period, will be required to pay 25% of the course fee prevailing at the time of enrolment. This benefit can be availed by the student for a further 12 months from the date of certificate expiry. 
 b) Student who opts to re-validate their certification post the 12 months from the certificate expiry, will have to pay the full course fee prevailing at the time of re-validation. 
 c) Upon payment of the re-validation fee, the student would be entitled to attend the entire course

A student who scores a DISTINCTION that is an aggregate of 85% or above, will earn the K11 Meritorious Scholarship.  The amount (K11 Money) that a student can earn in their K11 Meritorious Scholarship Wallet against each course is: 
 1.   Diploma in Personal Training: INR. 20,000/- 
 2.   Human Performance Nutrition certification course: INR. 20,000/- 
 3.  Personal Trainer for Special Populations: INR. 10,000/- 
 4.   Yog Prashikshak course : INR. 20,000/- 
 5.   CPT To DPT Upgradation : INR. 20,000/- 
 6.   HPN / PT SP course Revalidation : INR. 5,000/- 
 Note: The K11 Meritorious Scholarship is a Non-Cash scholarship award and the amount (K11 Money) earned can ONLY be redeemed by a student against further education with the K11 School of Fitness Sciences or the K11 School of Yog.
The student must be 18 years and above to be eligible for placement assistance
The student must hold a valid certificate to be eligible for placement assistance

Student of the Human Performance Nutrition Certification course can seek placement assistance from K11 for 21 months from the date of certification. The student will not be eligible for placement for the last three months of their certificate validity. The student is expected to re-validate the certificate during this period

Students are required to share their employment status to help K11 provide reports to the NSDC. This co-operation from the students is expected in return for the placement assistance provided by the K11 HR Department.
Placement assistance will be provided as per vacancies available in respective gyms/ clubs
Students who wish to seek placement assistance, need to send in a request at placements@keleven.com
Placement Assistance for Personal Trainers will ONLY be provided to the holders of K11 Diploma in Personal Training Certification with a VALID REPS India membership.
The course schedules are displayed on the school notice board at the reception

In case of any changes in the schedule, all students in the respective batch will be informed about the change either in the class or via calls/ SMS on the contact information shared by them during admission. It is the responsibility of the student to inform the school in case of any change in their contact information. K11 School of Fitness Sciences will not be responsible in case a student cannot be contacted due to the unavailability of the correct information.

he School cannot be held responsible for loss/ damage/ inconvenience caused due to misinformation received from unofficial sources like student’s WhatsApp groups, etc. Students should rely on information/ update/ communication received only from an official K11 source such as calls from K11 staff, text message or email from official K11 phone numbers and email ids, updates on K11's official website, etc.
The students must provide emergency contact numbers at the time of admission

Ex-Students have the option to attend Theory lectures with prior permission. The approval of the request made by the student is subject to seat availability in the desired batch. The request for the same needs to be done by writing an email to support@keleven.com
The course schedules are subject to change. The School reserves the right to schedule extra lectures as per the requirement of each batch.

A student who wishes to change their current batch to another batch of their choice will have to first submit a request to support@keleven.com. The student will be considered for the desired batch subject to seat availability. The course fees prevailing at the time of batch change would apply to the student
The use of LAB (Practical floor) is allowed only under the supervision of a K11 Master Trainer during the scheduled practical sessions which are part of the course.
A student must wear their ID Card while on school premises. A student will be refused entry to the school if in case they are found without their ID card
A student must carry their 'Practical attendance card (wherever applicable)' during practical sessions which are part of the course
It Is MANDATORY for a student to wear their ID cards for all lectures conducted by K11 outside school premises
ll students are expected to maintain discipline and punctuality
Students are expected to be present for their lectures 15 minutes before the scheduled time

Students are requested to vacate the school premises immediately at the end of their theory lectures or practical sessions. Use of school premises such as classroom or lab (practical floor) will not be permitted at any time apart from scheduled session timings

Use of smartphones, cameras and/ or any other electronic device used for video & audio recording of theory lectures and practical sessions is STRICTLY PROHIBITED. The device(s) of students, who are found guilty, will be confiscated. This will further lead to the expulsion of the student from all courses

Student(s) must fill the medical form along with the student admission form. They also need to inform the lecturer and the training faculty about any medical issues, pre-existing medical issues before commencing practical sessions. If the information submitted by the student is false, it will lead to expulsion from all courses

A temporary locker is provided to all students of the Diploma in Personal Training Course & the K11 Master Trainer Course during their practical sessions to keep their belongings. Every student is required to refer to the Locker Notice that is put up on the Lockers. The Management at K11 is not responsible for any Loss/ Damage/ Theft of student belongings. Lost and found items will be kept with school admin from where they may be collected within 3 days

he Course textbooks provided to students would be in the language that they have joined. If a student wishes to opt for a textbook in any other language, then they need to send an email to support@keleven.com requesting the same. The request needs to be made to the K11 Student Support cell before collecting the textbook. Course textbook once collected cannot be exchanged for another language
In case a student receives any component of the Student Kit in a damaged condition the student has to intimate the administrative desk of the respective school within 24 hours for a replacement

Any student who is found to be guilty of an offence involving (directly or indirectly) possession of banned drugs, alcohol, arms and weapons, or causing physical harm to a person, or threatened physical harm to a person, will be terminated with immediate effect from all enrolled courses with K11 SCHOOL OF FITNESS SCIENCES. In these cases, the student would be subjected to legal proceedings as per the law enforced by the Government of India.
The Management may from time to time change or modify the Terms & Conditions and the Rules & Regulations governing the operations of the school without prior notice.
The Management may from time to time introduce, discontinue or change any facility, service, faculty or equipment of the lab (practical floor) and school without prior notice
The Management may from time to time change the course fee without prior notice

The Management shall not be considered in default of its obligations in the instance of natural calamities such as floods, earthquakes, tornadoes, hurricanes, storms, heavy rainfall, as well as occurrences such as strikes, lockouts, war, or fire, etc. In case of unforeseen circumstances, the Management may also be forced to discontinue operations temporarily or permanently. Under such circumstances, the school will not be liable to pay ANY REFUND
The Management will not be responsible for any personal injury or accident sustained by individuals in and around the school premises. Individuals may use all school facilities at their own risk.
Parking of vehicles in and around the school premises is at the sole discretion of the students.
No arguments and disputes regarding course payments/ validity/ examinations will be entertained in the absence of system generated receipt.

Making copies of the K11 textbooks, course material, student kit and other content or the Intellectual Property of K11 School of Fitness Sciences is STRICTLY PROHIBITED by law. The act will lead to immediate termination from all courses without any refund and strict legal action will be taken against the student. The student will also be restricted admission from all courses across centres of K11 School of Fitness Sciences.

Any damage caused to the equipment or any other property due to misuse or negligence of the students will be the responsibility of the student. He/ she will be liable to reimburse the school for any damages caused. Failure of the same will result in expulsion from all courses and examinations.

Not abiding by or breaking any of the school rules will result in course termination for the student. In such cases, the student will NOT be given ANY REFUND and will NOT be issued certification(s) under any circumstance. For cases where a certificate has been issued and such an incident is identified, then the K11 School of Fitness Sciences reserves the right to revoke the certificate issued to the student

The K11 HR Department, as a part of placement assistance ideally will look for commercial gyms/ gym chains that have a corporatised structure with proper HR policies in place. The said gym will be preferred as recruiters if they provide appointment letters/ salary slips, provide clarity on mandatory deductions, clarity on commission structures. Gyms will also be chosen based on location as per high paying capacity customers (potential for high personal training income). These gyms very possibly could be far away from the K11 Certified student's residence. Income potential and growth potential will be prioritised over the convenience of travel and location in the interest of building careers for K11 certified fitness professionals.

Placement assistance provided by the K11 HR Department should not be misconstrued/ misunderstood/ misrepresented as any kind of job guarantee. Placement assistance provides an opportunity for giving interviews with prior grooming, interview presentation, resume presentation, advice, and preparation provided by K11. This increases the chances of giving interviews that result in employment.

fields.title: I HEREBY
fields.label: Confirm to have read and understood the Terms and Conditions regarding the Fees, Examinations, Certification(s), Placements along with the General Information and the School's Rules and regulations. I also confirm to have read and understood the Management Disclaimer and the informed consent and I hereby give my consent to all of the above.

fields.title: DECLARATION : I HEREBY AGREE THAT
fields.label: All declarations made in the student registration form for admission are accepted in good faith. Any false declarations about the information provided or failure to produce documentary evidence of the information provided may render a student liable to expulsion from the course

fields.title: DECLARATION : I HEREBY AGREE THAT
fields.label: In case of any pre-existing medical condition, the student will be interviewed by the Senior Management. The decision to allow the student to pursue the course is at the sole discretion of the Senior Management post-interview. In such cases, the decision of Senior Management is final and binding

fields.title: DECLARATION : I HEREBY AGREE THAT
fields.label: I also understand that submission of this Form is part of the admission process to the Course(s) and that the School Administrator shall contact me to complete the remainder of the admission process.
